findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 25 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act — including 0 critical and 25 high severity. Temporally verified against payment dates.

findings.label: Likely Duplicate Payments
findings.detail: 940 high-confidence duplicate groups with same supplier, amount, date and reference number

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 670 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week

findings.label: Round-Number Payments (>£5K)
findings.detail: 414 exact round-number payments over £5,000 — may indicate estimates rather than invoiced amounts

findings.label: Year-End Spending Spike
findings.detail: Regeneration & Housing spent 12.9x their monthly average in March — potential year-end budget rush worth £3.7M above normal

key_findings.title: B3P Services Ltd: £420.2K paid during active breach
Jds Trucks Ltd: £287.3K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: No active directors; No person with significant control registered

key_findings.title: Grant Thornton Uk Llp: £196.6K paid during active breach
HM LAND REGISTRY: 2422 transactions totalling £12.0K
key_findings.description: Averaging £5 per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier

key_findings.title: 37 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £28.1M total
key_findings.description: Compare what each council pays the same suppliers for similar services

key_findings.title: WALTON SUMMIT TRUCK CENTRE LTD: 115237% price gap between councils
